intro: Corethrostylis coriacea, commonly known as the rough-stemmed flame orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy red and orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit with tough, leathery leaves. Its stems are covered in a rough, scaly texture, which gives it its scientific name. Corethrostylis coriacea is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions and salt spray.
